column4: What does this mean? The filename "NAME-DESKTOP" indicates that this file is of type "desktop configuration file". The contents of the file indicate that the file is of type "x-directory/smb-share". If you open this file, the file might present a security risk to your system. I can't work out how to browse with smb.
does anyone know how to browse files/folders on the network with samba?
did you try the Network Servers thing in the Places menu?
yes. I can't get it to work
Does it show nothing at all?
it shows windows network icon, and if I click it, it then shows the workgroup name, and after that is a list of computers on the network.. but that is as far as I can get.
try hitting F5 to refresh it
I know it wont always let me explore the networked server the first time I click it
Does it give some kind of an error?
Could you post the error, or post a pastebin link if its more than a line or two
It seems like you arent havent the same problem I had with samba.  I found a thread that seemed like your problem on the forums though.  Maybe something there that can help you.

it's entirely possible that I may have deleted something from my ubuntu system which it needs to use samba file sharing. This may be why it does not appear to know how to browse the other computers on the network, giving the error instead...
you can try "sudo apt-get install samba smbfs"
